content.description:
Follow the obvious vertical crack then continue in a small but long right facing corner with a crack. Its almost straight up all the way up.



Obvious rock feature exiting the wall at the start, forming a left facing corner. There is a small cedar about two meters above the ground. The vertical crack (with rounded holes) above the tree is also easily recognizable.

trad

Same start as "2 temps, 3 mouvements", follow the obvious vertical crack. Before reaching trees and small (but long) roof, go left on a slab until you reach the left facing corner system. Climb up the reach the left facing corner and continue straight up in the corner. Then follow the obvious easiest way up (going left, then up, then back to the right).



Same start as "2 temps, 3 mouvements", follow the obvious vertical crack.


trad, alpine draws are useful

climbs.name: Le temps des pieds précis
climbs.fa: Sébastien Morin, Mylène Beaudry, Bernard Mailhot, Éric Marquis et Myriam Fafard

content.description:
Some hard slab climbing right at the start gets you at the bottom of easy runout slab climbing, going to the 4th bolt (far). Seriously if you managed to get to that point without aiding, just keep doing whatever you were doing and you'll be fine reaching that far bolt.

Then you're done with sport climbing - enjoy easier (10a/b ?) trad climb on nice flake, then pull some spectacular looking (but actually not that hard) bulge moves to the anchor (trees). 



You'll see 2 bolts above you from the ledge.

A series of 3 bolts, than a spaced-out one. After that all gear. Gear is there and decent but not all that easy to find/place correctly in all cases. Do bring your lead head.

First section is slab, finish in two small (finger size) parallel cracks going diagonally left.



When approaching from the top, the rappel brings you directly at the start of the route.

Locate the one visible bolt.


trad, 4 bolts.

Start with easy slab moves going up and right. At the first glue-in, go straight up toward a small roof (there is a flake in the roof). Keep up on the slab (2 glue-in), attack a more vertical section with large cracks and finish the route near a white birch.



Same start as "Toit dans le temps", the right-most start. 


trad, belay on a good tree at the top. Rap station with 2 glue-in

Start with easy slab moves going up and right until you reach a first bolt. Keep the right (to the left is route Temps-tation, 5.8) toward a small roof (second bolt). Continue toward a second roof (third bolt) and pass in a small, left facing corner.



The right-most route of the sector as of (2021). 


trad, up to camalot #2, 3 glue-in, good tree at the top for belay

Great sector developed in 2020 by Éric Marquis, Myriam Fafard et Sébastien Morin. All routes are long (~35-40 meters raps, tie a knots and have a long or double ropes). Trad climbs with the occasional bolt where relevant. Bolting (and grading) is Pinacle-style, on the spicier side and no gimmies.  Nothing extreme, but you want to have a good lead head and be comfortable above your gear at the grade.
